org.openide.windows

Class FoldHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openide.windows.FoldHandle

  • public final class FoldHandle
extends Object
    An object that refers to a fold in output window. It can be used to finish the fold, or to create nested folds.
    Since:
    openide.io/1.38

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finish()
      Finish the fold at the current last line in the output window.
      FoldHandle getCurrentNestedFold()
      Get current nested fold.
      FoldHandle getLastNestedFold()
      Get handle created by the last invocation of startFold(boolean) or silentStartFold(boolean).
      boolean isFinished()
      Check whether this fold handle has been finished.
      void setExpanded(boolean expanded)
      Set state of the fold.
      void silentFinish()
      Similar to finish(), but no exception is thrown if the fold handle has been already finished.
      FoldHandle silentStartFold(boolean expanded)
      Similar to startFold(boolean), but no exception is thrown if the fold is already finished, as well as if an unfinished nested fold exists.
      FoldHandle startFold(boolean expanded)
      Start a nested fold at the current last line in output window.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Finish the fold at the current last line in the output window.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if parent fold has been already finished, or if there is an unfinished child fold.

      • startFold

        public FoldHandle startFold(boolean expanded)
        Start a nested fold at the current last line in output window.
        Parameters:
        expanded - True to expand the new fold, false to collapse it, parent folds will not be collapsed/expanded.
        Returns:
        Handle for the newly created fold.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the fold has been already finished, or if an unfinished nested fold exists.

      • setExpanded

        public void setExpanded(boolean expanded)
        Set state of the fold. If a nested fold is expanded, all parent folds will be expanded too.
        Parameters:
        expanded - True to expand the fold, false to collapse it.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Check whether this fold handle has been finished.
        Returns:
        True if finish() or silentFinish() has been already called on this fold handle, false otherwise.
        Since:
        openide.io/1.42

      • getLastNestedFold

        @CheckForNull
public FoldHandle getLastNestedFold()
        Get handle created by the last invocation of startFold(boolean) or silentStartFold(boolean). The handle can be finished or unfinished.
        Returns:
        The last started nested fold. Can be null.
        Since:
        openide.io/1.42

      • getCurrentNestedFold

        @CheckForNull
public FoldHandle getCurrentNestedFold()
        Get current nested fold. Similar to getLastNestedFold(), but returns null if the last nested fold has been already finished.
        Returns:
        The last unfinished nested fold or null.
        Since:
        openide.io/1.42

      • silentFinish

        public void silentFinish()
        Similar to finish(), but no exception is thrown if the fold handle has been already finished. If an unfinished child fold exists, it will be finished too. Any exception that could happen will be caught and logged.
        Since:
        openide.io/1.42

      • silentStartFold

        @CheckForNull
public FoldHandle silentStartFold(boolean expanded)
        Similar to startFold(boolean), but no exception is thrown if the fold is already finished, as well as if an unfinished nested fold exists. If an unfinished nested fold exists, it will be finished before creation of the new one.
        Parameters:
        expanded - True to expand the new fold, false to collapse it, parent folds will not be collapsed/expanded.
        Returns:
        The new fold handle, or null if it cannot be created.
        Since:
        openide.io/1.42
